article: My husband and I married in a large country town. The morning after the wedding, we were going back to my parents' home. As my husband was packing, I noticed he'd placed my 31 _ in the luggage crate on top of the car. I said that maybe he should _ it. He turned and said, "It'll be _ . Trust me! It won't come off." Halfway home we had a car come racing up beside us and the driver _ us down. She said she'd seen a red suitcase on the side of the road several kilometers back and was  _ if it was ours. We looked _ and, to our 37 _ , discovered that the case had flown off.   We raced back, but the case was _ . We visited the local police station, but as the road was a common link between several towns, we weren't very _ . We put it all down to our bad _ .   Seven years later, my father got a(n) _ from a lady asking if I'd lost a red suitcase. Her husband had picked up the case abandoned on the side of the road. He assumed he'd be able to find an address or name somewhere inside and _ it later. On opening the case, they'd found the wedding cards, no address, and no way of _ who we were. They'd spent seven years moving around the area, always taking the suitcase with them.   They were about to _ again and decided to give it one more _ before leaving. This time, on opening the jewellery box, they 47 _ a piece of paper folded up in it -- -- my birth certificate. _ that my parents were still in the district, they started to ring around. The suitcase was _ returned to us.   This couple's _ and persistence in finding us is truly admirable.
